quote: He taught us the gods wore watch chains.
author: Degas

quote: being a man eternally polishing his spectacles without ever looking through them.
author: Popper

prequote: The breakthrough came when an acting teacher, Jack Kosslyn, delivered a precept that Eastwood often quoted:
quote: Don't just do something; stand there!
author: Jack Kosslyn

quote: There is no reason why the truth when found should be interesting.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The sleep of reason brings forth monsters.
author: Goya

quote: Virtue resides in the taming of a baser instinct, not in its elimination.
author: Clive James

quote: Science is what we know, and philosophy is what we don't know.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Beauty is the promise of happiness.
author: Stendhal

quote: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster.
author: Nietzsche

quote: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
author: Degas

quote: People say that life's the thing, but I prefer reading.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Hypocrisy is the tribute that vice pays to virtue.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Don't let the old man in.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
author: Thomas Mann
